content.description: <math alttext="The figure presents a 2 row table, with 10 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “x,” and the heading for row 2 is “f of x.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. x is 1. f of x is negative 4. Column 2. x is 1.9. f of x is negative 1.399. Column 3. x is 1.99. f of x is negative 1.040. Column 4. x is 1.999. f of x is negative 1.004. Column 5. x is 1.9999. f of x is negative 1.000. Column 6. x is 2.0001. f of x is 6.001. Column 7. x is 2.001. f of x is 6.012. Column 8. x is 2.01. f of x is 6.121. Column 9. x is 2.1. f of x is 7.261. Column 10. x is 3. f of x is 25." overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="3em 0.05em 3em 4em 4em 4em 4em 4em 4em 4em 4em 3em" equalcolumns="false" equalrows="true" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0.5ex" rowlines="solid" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1.9</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1.99</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1.999</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1.9999</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2.0001</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2.001</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2.01</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2.1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mtd><mtd><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1.399</mn></mrow></mtd><mtd><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1.040</mn></mrow></mtd><mtd><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1.004</mn></mrow></mtd><mtd><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1.000</mn></mrow></mtd><mtd><mn>6.001</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>6.012</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>6.121</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>7.261</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>25</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: The table above gives values of the function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> at selected values of <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following conclusions is supported by the data in the table?

choices.label: <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 2, of, f of x, equals negative 1" overflow="scroll"> <mrow> <munder> <mo>lim</mo> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>→</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </munder> <mi>f</mi> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mo>−</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </math>

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches 2, of, f of x, equals 6" overflow="scroll"> <mrow> <munder> <mo>lim</mo> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>→</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </munder> <mi>f</mi> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mn>6</mn> </mrow> </math>

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches 2 from the left, of, f of x, equals negative 1" overflow="scroll"> <mrow> <munder> <mo>lim</mo> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>→</mo> <msup> <mn>2</mn> <mo>−</mo> </msup> </mrow> </munder> <mi>f</mi> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mo>−</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </math> and <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 2 from the right, of, f of x, equals 6" overflow="scroll"> <mrow> <munder> <mo>lim</mo> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>→</mo> <msup> <mn>2</mn> <mo>+</mo> </msup> </mrow> </munder> <mi>f</mi> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mn>6</mn> </mrow> </math>

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches 2 from the left, of, f of x, equals 6" overflow="scroll"> <mrow> <munder> <mo>lim</mo> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>→</mo> <msup> <mn>2</mn> <mo>−</mo> </msup> </mrow> </munder> <mi>f</mi> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mn>6</mn> </mrow> </math> and <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 2 from the right, of, f of x, equals negative 1" overflow="scroll"> <mrow> <munder> <mo>lim</mo> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>→</mo> <msup> <mn>2</mn> <mo>+</mo> </msup> </mrow> </munder> <mi>f</mi> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mo>−</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 2 from the left, of, f of x, equals negative 1" overflow="scroll"> <mrow> <munder> <mo>lim</mo> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>→</mo> <msup> <mn>2</mn> <mo>−</mo> </msup> </mrow> </munder> <mi>f</mi> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mo>−</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </math> and <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 2 from the right, of, f of x, equals 6" overflow="scroll"> <mrow> <munder> <mo>lim</mo> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>→</mo> <msup> <mn>2</mn> <mo>+</mo> </msup> </mrow> </munder> <mi>f</mi> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mn>6</mn> </mrow> </math>

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
